Package au.edu.anu.omhtk.jars

Class Jars

java.lang.Object
au.edu.anu.omhtk.jars.Jars
public abstract class Jars extends Object

A class to package items into a jar file with a version number. Includes a manifest file.

Usage:

  1. Define a descendant class setting the proper fields needed by your specific jar packing task.
  2. Create an instance of this class.
  3. Populate the instance with request to add entries to the jar using all the add<something> methods.
  4. Set the main class / application entry point, if any.
  5. Call saveJar(...) from the instance to create the jar file.
Author:
Shayne Flint
refactored by Jacques Gignoux 2017
added merging of services from multiple jars by Ian Davies 2020.

    • getRunningJarFilePath

      public static String getRunningJarFilePath​(Class<?> klass)

      Test if, at runtime, the origin of the class argument is in a jar. [hack found here]. The test depends on the presence of a manifest in the jar. This test is needed if we must specifically load generated classes

      Parameters:
      klass - The class to search for.
      Returns:
      The file path string.

    • addFile

      public void addFile​(String fileName, String jarDirectory)
      Add any file (i.e. not only java classes) to this jar.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the file.
      jarDirectory - The directory where the file resides.

    • addResources

      public void addResources​(String packageName)
      Recursive addition of (non-java) resources in jars (i.e. excluding .java and .class files). Collects all non-java files from the package argument and adds them to this jar.
      CAUTION: directory names including dots are not supported (e.g. workflow.graffle).
      Parameters:
      packageName - the java package name to search for resources, i.e. with dots as separators

    • addResourceFile

      public void addResourceFile​(String resourceName, String packageName)
      Add a single (non-java) resource file to this jar.
      CAUTION: directory names including dots are not supported (e.g. workflow.graffle).
      Parameters:
      resourceName - the name of the resource
      packageName - the java package name to search for the resource, i.e. with dots as separators

    • addIvyLibrary

      public void addIvyLibrary​(String org, String name, String version)
      Add an external ivy library to this jar.
      Parameters:
      org - organisation responsible for the library maintenance - see ivy specification for explanation
      name - library name
      version - library version - see ivy specification for the version number interpretation

    • addJar

      public void addJar​(String jarPath)
      Add the content of a jar file to this jar.
      Parameters:
      jarPath - the path to the jar file which entries are to be copied

    • saveJar

      public void saveJar​(File jarFile)
      Save this jar information a properly formatted jar file. Uses all the information stored in its fields following calls to add...(...) and manifest property values. Also packs jar services found in included jars. The method prevents attempts to add duplicates.
      Parameters:
      jarFile - the name of the jar file to create

    • listJarContents

      public void listJarContents​(String fileName)
      Utility to list the content of a jar file.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the jar file to list.
